Welcome! ðŸ‘‹

I'm Antonio Marino, a passionate AI researcher working at the intersection of multi-agent systems and reinforcement learning.

Currently pursuing my PhD at the University of Cambridge and working as an AI Researcher at Meta AI. My research focuses on developing novel algorithms for heterogeneous multi-agent systems, with applications in robotics and autonomous systems.

I'm particularly interested in:

  • ðŸ¤– Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning - Developing coordination strategies for diverse agent teams
  • ðŸ§  Graph Neural Networks - Leveraging graph structures for agent communication and learning
  • ðŸ”¬ Simulation Environments - Building high-performance tools for multi-agent research
  • ðŸš€ Real-world Applications - Bridging the gap between research and practical robotics

My work has been published in top-tier venues including ICML, IROS, and NeurIPS workshops. I'm also a core contributor to several open-source projects in the PyTorch ecosystem, including VMAS and BenchMARL.

When I'm not coding or researching, you can find me exploring new technologies, contributing to the open-source community, or sharing knowledge through talks and tutorials.

ðŸŽ¯ Currently: Working on LLM agents for long-horizon tasks and heterogeneous multi-robot coordination systems.
